name: Athenaeum Hotel & Apartments

reviews.text: From the moment we stepped out of the taxi, we new this was going to be a stay to remember,.
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.text: The staff, the rooms were just amazing.
reviews.title: Excelant London Hotel

reviews.text: I have stayed in many 5 star hotel's in London, but this beat them all. Ritz, Savoy, eat your heart out !!!!
reviews.title: Amazing place to stay with kids!

reviews.text: The hospitality and service was the finest.
reviews.title: What a find!!!

reviews.text: The room, the fridge, the beds, towels, sheets, were just out of this world.
reviews.title: Quite lovely

reviews.text: The Athenaeum hotel is a real find - comfortable rooms with free Nespresso, snacks, juices, soft drinks, fast wifi and really great showers equal a perfect stay in the heart of Mayfair overlooking Green Park. A great location for shoppers alike, just 10 mins walk from Buckingham palace - what's not to like! Marcia on the front desk couldn't do enough for me, moving me to a higher floor at my request and making sure I was on a quiet side street so I could get my work done.
reviews.title: Gem in Mayfair...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only reason I would not give five stars is the communal areas of the hotel are small and the bar not up to the standard of the more classic 5 stars in London - but with this location? I'm not sure that it matters!
reviews.title: Astounding Athenaeum

reviews.text: A warm welcome from everybody - the Doorman, Reception and also the Chambermaid - especially - Marcia - Reception and Irene in the Back Office. They heard it was my Birthday and they really spoilt us - cake, Birthday Card etc. Splendid accommodation with wonderful walk-in shower and fine views. The attention to detail was second to none and the best we have ever encountered in the 5 star hotel and we are seasoned world travellers. Breakfast was fresh and very good - we will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Green Park

reviews.text: John & Gail - Brighton
reviews.title: Not quite what I was hoping for...

reviews.text: Great medium sized hotel close to sights and shopping. Good for business and pleasure.
reviews.title: I highly recommend.

reviews.text: I came up to London with my husband and baby and immediately on arrival we were grilled about what we were doing in london it was really over the top and it felt like an interview. Check in was a laborious procedure wanting credit card authorisations or cash upfront as a deposit. We went up to the room and the coffee machine didnt work at first which was annoying so someone had to come out. In the bathroom i spotted at least 3 silverfish on the dirty floor and pubes in the bathtub. The duvet didnt have a cover and the pillows were so soft and the bed uncomfortable i hardly slept at all and the air con was temperamental, the coffee pot at breakfast leaked everywhere, they forgot the bread basket and I was disgusted at how overpriced breakfast in bed is, 55 quid for 2 people... ridiculous! on check out the maid went to check the room and came back to say we had smoked in the room, because she found a cigarette butt in an empty water bottle and they charged us 200 quid, apparently it was now impossible to rent out the room due to smoke damage but yet when i said that i would then take the room because apparently no one could possibly use it according to the manageress the receptionist then wanted the room rate on top.... Yes i smoked leaning out of the window ONE cigarette, and the window had been open from 9 am til 12 am so there was no smell at all, but to fine me and then treat me like I had committed the crime of the century was over the top, I asked if they could waive the charge but the mean manageress said there was no way she could and it left what could have been a nice stay into the worst possible hotel experience. The rest of the day we were left feeling cheated, ripped off and really upset by the ordeal. I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER, TREATED REALLY BADLY

reviews.text: I stayed in the Athenaeum with my daughter on Sunday, April 15th. We were upgraded from the basic level of room. The room was very comfortable, with lovely views over Green Park, and the two plates of fruit on the table were very welcome, as were the free soft drinks, and kettle, however, the coffee made by the coffee machine was almost undrinkable, so after the first try, we didn't use it again. The bed was very comfortable as well, and the bathroom had the biggest walk-in shower I have ever seen!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel - but a few glitches.

reviews.text: All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful, especially the gentleman who held the outside door open for us as we went in and out.
reviews.title: Brilliant stay for my birthday boy!

reviews.text: We didn't eat in the hotel, so I can't comment on the food, but it did seem rather expensive.
reviews.title: Great family apartment

reviews.text: Now for the glitches! There was something wrong with the gadget on the bedside table which was supposed to turn off the lights - it turned off all the lights except the one furthest away, by the door, so I had to get out of bed, turn off the light and grope my way back to bed in the dark! There was one spotlight bulb not working, which could have affected it, I suppose. In the morning I had just finished my shower, when the light suddenly went out in the bathroom, and I had to grope my way wetly, wrapped in a towel, and open the door to switch it on again. It would have been a lot more serious if I had actually been in the shower or the bath. The light switched on with no problems, so I don't know why it went off in
reviews.title: 10th April, 2012

reviews.text: I stayed for a few nights in the Athenaeum with my friend last month which was an absolute pleasure!! From the moment you first arrive you are greeted by the friendly doormen and welcomed in to this family friendly hotel which exudes excellent customer service as would be expected in a well run family business!!
reviews.title: Amazing hotel in a excellent location with world class service!!
Fantastic Hotel In Centre of London
reviews.text: The rooms are beautifully decorated and very spacious. The shower is nice and powerful, and there is big bath sheets/towels which to me is always a sign of a good hotel!! There is a "nespresso" coffee machine and a free mini bar except alcohol..I enjoyed some snacks from the mini bar while i watched a dvd which you can pick up from reception....they have a list which you can pick from at no charge. Also what I always have to pay for in hotels, of which the Athenaeum does NOT charge is speedy FREE wifi!!!

The location is excellent as its just a few steps away from the tube station but also very close to Buckingham palace, where i just took a walk across the park opposite the hotel and on the other side found buckingham palace!! Also in the other direction you can walk to all the shops on oxford/bond and regent street!
reviews.title: Return To Athenaeum Just Grand

reviews.text: The restaurant also looks really nice, not like your usual hotel restaurant where tables are usually just lined up to fit as many people in as possible. We had to try the afternoon tea here, which was AMAZING, as it won the best afternoon tea in london...very worthy winner!!i loved the macaroons!!
reviews.title: Awesome place, superb service, best place to stay in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this hotel is brilliant with very friendly and helpful staff on hand to cater to all your needs. I will definitely be booking in here next time I visit london. I would reccomend this hotel to business people and families alike as it seems to have alot of facilities for the kids!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in fantastic location!

description: **Free Wi-fi / Free mini bar soft drinks & snacks / Kids eat free when dining with an adult **The Athenaeum is the luxury London hotel with a big personality. Ideally located in Mayfair, overlooking leafy Green Park - it’s just a stroll away from Buckingham Palace, the West End and the capital's best shops. A selection of stunning rooms, suites and luxurious, homely apartments make The Athenaeum the perfect choice for families and business travellers alike. In-room facilities include complimentary soft drinks and snacks from the minibar, free Wi-Fi, Bose docking stations and flat screen TVs. Kids eat free when dining with adults. Don’t miss the award-winning afternoon tea, beautiful restaurant, cosy Whisky Bar and charming boutique spa. It is your home from home in London.
